name: FamiStudio Project
summary: Learn about .FMS files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: FamiStudio allows gamers and chiptune enthusiasts to create, edit, and publish 8-bit video game music. These enthusiasts can then share their songs with others or include them in their own, homebrew NES games.
Each FamiStudio song project is saved as an FMS file. These files describe a song's included tracks, patterns, samples, notes, and instruments.

When opened in FamiStudio, FMS files appear as a series of color-coded blocks (patterns), with notes arranged within each block. In FamiStudio, users can edit and play the song an FMS file describes, and they can export the song in a variety of audio, video, project, and code formats.

description: An FMS file is a project file created by BleuBleu FamiStudio, a Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) and Famicon music editor. It contains a song a user has created in FamiStudio, likely comprised of multiple tracks, patterns, and samples. The songs FMS files contain sound like NES and Famicon video game music.

instructions: You can open an FMS file with FamiStudio. To do so, select the Folder icon located in FamiStudio's menu bar. Then, navigate to and open your FMS file.
You can use FamiStudio to export the song an FMS file contains in a variety of formats, including (but not limited to):
Select the File with Arrow icon located in FamiStudio's menu bar.
Name and save your exported file.

images.alt: Screenshot of a .fms file in BleuBleu FamiStudio
images.caption: FMS file open in BleuBleu FamiStudio
